==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=|rs=匕09}}

# [[spoon]]

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[じ]] (ji)
|kanon=[[し]] (shi)
|kanyoon=[[ひ]] (hi)
|kun=[[かい]] (kai), [[さじ]] (saji), [[しゃじ]] (shaji), [[すくい]] (sukui)
}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|じ}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=じ}} {{m|ltc|匙|tr=zhiɛ||spoon}}. The [[呉音#Japanese|''goon'']], so likely the earliest borrowing from {{etyl|ltc|-}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|じ}}

====Suffix====
{{ja-pos|suffix|じ}}

# [[spoon]], [[scoop]]

=====Usage notes=====
Only found in compounds.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|香匙|きょうじ}}: a [[spoon]] or [[scoop]] used to scoop out [[incense]]
* {{ja-r|火匙|こじ}}: a [[pair]] of [[tongs]] or [[chopsticks]] (usually metal), used to handle [[live]] [[coal]]s or [[burning]] [[incense]]
* {{ja-r|匙|さじ}}: a [[spoon]] or [[scoop]]
* {{ja-r|匙|しゃじ}}: a [[spoon]] or [[scoop]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|し}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=じ}} {{m|zh|匙|tr=zhiɛ||spoon}}. The [[漢音#Japanese|''kan'on'']], so a later borrowing. Compare modern {{cog|yue|匙|tr=ci<sup>4</sup>}}, {{cog|nan|匙|tr=sî}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|し}}

====Suffix====
{{ja-pos|suffix|し}}

# [[spoon]], [[scoop]]

=====Usage notes=====
Only found in compounds.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|円匙|えんし}}: a [[spoon]]-shaped [[spade]] for [[digging]]
* {{ja-r|鑰匙|やくし}}: a [[key]] {{qualifier|from the vague similarity in shape to a [[spoon]], with the bowl of the spoon as the handle of the key}}
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|ひ}}
Likely an alteration of the [[漢音#Japanese|''kan'on'']] reading ''shi'': {{IPAchar|/si/}} → {{IPAchar|/hi/}}

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=ky|ひ}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|匕}}

====Affix====
{{ja-pos|affix|ひ}}

# [[spoon]], [[scoop]]

=====Usage notes=====
Only found in compounds.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|円匙|えんぴ}}: a [[spoon]]-shaped [[spade]] for [[digging]]
* {{ja-r|匙量|ひりょう}}: a [[spoonful]], as when [[measuring]] [[medicine]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かい}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=かい}} {{m|ja|貝|tr=kai||shellfish, clam; clam shell}}, from the way that clam shells were used as [[scoop]]s.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|かい}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|匕}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かい|hhira=かひ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かい|obsolete}} a [[scoop]] for [[food]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=かい|archaic|rare}} a [[wooden]] [[sword]] for [[training]]
#: This sense developed from an [[ateji]] spelling of {{ja-l|木刀}} (literally, “wooden blade”) applied to the ''[[food]] [[scoop]]'' meaning.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|飯匙|いいがい}}: {{qualifier|obsolete}} a [[rice]] [[scoop]]
* {{ja-r|御台匙|おだいがい}}: {{qualifier|obsolete}} a [[rice]] [[scoop]]
* {{ja-r|匙笥|かいげ}}: a small [[bucket]] or [[basin]] used in the bath to scoop water from the tub to pour over oneself
* {{ja-r|切匙|せっかい}}, {{ja-r|狭匙|せっかい}}, {{ja-r|刷匙|せっかい}}: a [[scoop]] used to scrape off ground material stuck to the inner surface of a [[mortar]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 5===
[[File:Chinese spoons.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|匙}} (''saji''): a '''[[spoon]]'''.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|さじ}}
Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=さじ|茶|tr1=sa|t1=tea|pos=the [[唐音#Japanese|''tōon'']] or Tang reading|匙|tr2=ji|t2=spoon, scoop}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref> This [[音読み#Japanese|''on'yomi'']] reading for a two-character term was then applied to the single-character {{lang|ja|匙}} spelling, and re-interpreted as [[訓読み#Japanese|''kun'yomi'']].

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|さじ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=2|acc2_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|匕}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|さじ}}

# [[spoon]], [[scoop]] used for food
#: {{ja-usex|私たちは'''さじ'''でスープを飲む。|^わたしたち は '''さじ''' で スープ を のむ。|We eat soup with a '''spoon'''.}}
# more specifically, a spoon or scoop used for [[compounding]] [[medicine]]
# by extension, [[medicine]]
# by further extension, a [[doctor]]

=====Usage notes=====
In modern Japanese, the term {{ja-r|スプーン}} is used to refer to spoons in general, including spoons as found in the Western world. The term ''saji'' generally refers more to the broad, usually flat-bottomed Asian-style spoon shown at right.

The ''saji'' reading is the most common in modern Japanese when using this term as a standalone noun.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|石匙|いし さじ}}: {{qualifier|neolithic}} a [[stone]] [[spoon]] or [[scoop]]
* {{ja-r|大匙|おおさじ}}: a large [[spoon]] or [[scoop]], a [[ladle]]; a [[tablespoon]], a unit of measure of 15ml
* {{ja-r|御匙|おさじ}}: a [[spoon]] {{qualifier|polite speech}}; a [[doctor]] {{qualifier|especially one tending to a high-ranking [[samurai]] family}}
* {{ja-r|御匙医師|おさじ いし}}: a [[doctor]] {{qualifier|especially one tending to a high-ranking [[samurai]] family}}
* {{ja-r|香匙|こう さじ}}: an [[incense]] [[scoop]]
* {{ja-r|小匙|こさじ}}: a small [[spoon]] or [[scoop]]; a [[teaspoon]], a unit of measure of 5ml
* {{ja-l|匙沢瀉}}, {{ja-r|匙面高|さじおもだか}}: a [[perennial]] [[flowering]] [[plant]], {{taxlink|Alisma plantago-aquatica var. orientale|subspecies|noshow=1}} ({{vern|common water plantain}}, {{vern|mad-dog weed}})
* {{ja-r|匙加減|さじかげん}}: literally, “spoon moderation”: the degree of [[skill]] in [[compounding]] [[medicine]]; a [[doctor]]'s method of [[treatment]]; the [[balance]] of [[flavor]]s in a [[dish]]; [[knack]] or [[finesse]] in doing something
* {{ja-r|匙が回る|さじ が まわる}}: {{sense|idiom}} “the spoon goes around” → to be [[skillful]] at compounding medicine
* {{ja-r|匙先|さじさき}}: literally, “spoon tip”: the degree of [[skill]] in [[compounding]] [[medicine]]; a [[doctor]]'s [[skill]] in treatment
* {{ja-r|匙を投げる|さじ を なげる}}: {{sense|idiom}} “throw the spoon” → [[throw in the towel]]
* {{ja-r|茶匙|ちゃ さじ}}: a [[teaspoon]] {{qualifier|a spoon used for tea}}; a [[teaspoon]], a unit of measure of 5ml
* {{ja-r|角匙|つの さじ}}: a [[spoon]] made from [[horn]], such as a [[cow]]'s horn, used historically when working with [[medicine]]s
* {{ja-r|灰匙|はい さじ}}: a [[spoon]] or [[scoop]] used to scoop out ashes from the [[brazier]] used for [[tea ceremony]]
* {{ja-r|浜匙|はまさじ}}: a [[perennial]] [[plant]], {{taxlink|Limonium tetragonum|species|noshow=1}} ({{vern|autumn statice}} or {{vern|square-stem statice}})
* {{ja-r|一匙飯|ひとさじ めし}}: a single [[scoop]] of cooked rice {{qualifier|viewed as inadequate and bad luck to eat just this amount, with some superstitions that eating just this would cause one to become a stepmother or stepchild}}
{{der-bottom}}

=====Idioms=====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-r|匙の先より口の先|さじ の さき より くち の さき}}: “not so much the tip of their spoon, as the tip of their tongue” → a [[pejorative]] comment about a [[doctor]], stating that they are better at [[flattery]] and speaking nicely, than they are at actual [[medical]] [[treatment]]
{{der-bottom}}

=====Synonyms=====
{{der-top|Synonyms}}
* {{sense|spoon, scoop}} {{ja-r|スプーン}}; {{ja-r|蓮華|れんげ}}: literally, “lotus leaf” from the similarity shape
* {{sense|medicine}} {{ja-r|薬|くすり}}
* {{sense|doctor}} {{ja-r|医者|いしゃ}}
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 6===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|しゃじ}}
Appears to be an alteration of ''saji'' above: {{IPAchar|[sad͡ʑi]}} → {{IPAchar|[ɕad͡ʑi]}}<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|しゃじ|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=1|acc2_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しゃじ}}

# [[spoon]]

=====Usage notes=====
This reading does not appear to be as common as the ''saji'' reading above. May be [[dialectal]].

===Etymology 7===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|すくい}}
Alternate spelling of {{m|ja|掬い|tr=sukui||scoop}}, the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|掬う|tr=sukuu||to scoop}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Rare. Only found in compounds.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|すくい}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|すくい|hhira=すくひ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=すくい|rare}} a [[scoop]]

=====Usage notes=====
Although the general term ''sukui'' can serve as a standalone noun, this particular {{lang|ja|匙}} spelling for ''sukui'' is only found in compounds.

{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|香匙|こうすくい}}: an [[incense]] [[scoop]]
{{der-bottom}}
